Watching John Cassavetes film, Opening Night, I was reminded of something that Quentin Tarantino said once in an interview about personal experience in being a creator. He said:
“I don’t think there’s any such thing as this has happened to me; therefore, I should film this. I don’t believe that’s good enough to be the reason to become a filmmaker. And I just encourage people not to be that guy. I really do, because there just are too

A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In post- colonial London, she faces racism, sexism, and D-day Veterans – the man gets the girls? All of the actors are white which in itself is forgiveable – in Horse-whisperer style the trainer becomes great friend substitute parent, but not a romantic figure – and potentially a sweet endearing film.

Although there is melodrama at the center or rather at the bottom of this film, the story is told beautifully and subtly and the acting is superb.

For a dystopian piece on 'race relations' and 'real estate and housing problems' in US, this film does a fantastic job and creates a believable and sympathetic world. I especially appreciated how director/writer Jordan Peele makes us question how we should treat those whom we perceive to be different. In

This is, without a doubt, one of my favorite Columbo episodes ever. The acting is very well done, the music is very catchy, the script and dialogue are quite clever and the setting is just mesmerizing. If you enjoy a good murder mystery set in a fairground then you will really love this one. Leland follows the story of Leland P. Fitzgerald (Ryan Gosling), a disaffected teenager who has apparently murdered a severely retarded peer, the brother of popular high school student Allison (Jodi Foster) leads to an extraordinary trial that weighs moral response to a child's illness against the demands of justice. The nature of hate, guilt, and responsibility come into question as Leland attacks his lawyer (Anthony Hopkins) and the moral imagination involved in the case is tested.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he pursued and the books, paintings and haiku he made.
